definition: to be suffused with white/to be discolored/to blanch

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: There were only a few dry bones left, bleached by the sun.
sentences.chinese: 一些被太陽曬得泛白的枯骨。

sentences.english: In the east, the sky was becoming light.
A man sing love songs, the white knuckles, declare we hopeless love .
sentences.chinese: 一個人唱情歌，泛白的指節，述說我們無望的愛情。

sentences.english: The dry, white trickling sand of the dunes was warm to the touch.
sentences.chinese: 沙丘上乾燥泛白的沙子摸起來很暖和。

sentences.english: The sun shone whitely through the mist.
sentences.chinese: 太陽光穿過大霧泛白地照耀着。

sentences.english: Youth white, remain in the memory.
White cherry blossom whitening of memory.
sentences.chinese: 素白的櫻花，泛白了記憶。

sentences.english: In the east, the sky was becoming .
Meanwhile, optimizing selection of process parameters are made to reduce fibre white specks .
sentences.chinese: 同時，對減少纖維泛白的工藝參數，進行了優化選擇。

sentences.english: Fifty-seven, his hair is just beginning to go grey.
sentences.chinese: 他五十七了纔開始雙鬢泛白呢。

definition: to turn pale/to lose color/to go white
Qingbaijiang district of Chengdu city 成都市[Cheng2 du1 shi4], Sichuan
wisps of blood/visible veins/(of eyes) bloodshot
color (of one's skin, a sign of good health)/red of cheeks
